articles.title: Working-level talks proposed to north preparatory committee of August 15 Festival
Despicable trick
articles.content:
Working-level talks proposed to north preparatory committee of August 15 Festival
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee of the south headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) for a "grand festival for national reconciliation, unity and reunification" proposed to  the north counterpart to have working-level talks on the preparations of the festival, the joint secretariat of Pomminryon said.
   The south preparatory committee of Pomminryon expressed the determination to work hard for the success of the August 15 festival proposed at the conference of political parties and organisations of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, and bitterly denounced schemings of the present "government" of South Korea which is trying to keep Pomminryon and the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon), which are the main force and vanguard of reunification movement, from taking part in the festival, as an act of laying a chill on the desires of patriotic-minded people for reunification, the joint secretariat of Pomminryon said.
   With a view to discussing technical matters on the holding of the festival, the south side proposed to  have working-level talks between the preparatory committees of both sides in Beijing in mid-July.
   The north preparatory committee decided to accept the proposal, considering it to be a patriotic one to make the success of the festival in the teeth of challenges from anti-reunification forces at home and abroad and pave the path of great unity of the entire nation and reunification.
   It also expressed the expectations that the south preparatory committee would maintain the position as the main force and come to the talks together with representatives of all political parties, groups and social sectors of South Korea which want to participate in the festival with the desires for national reconciliation, unity and reunification.

articles.title: Institute on S. Korean authorities' anti-north campaign
articles.content:
Despicable trick
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The South Korean puppets are spreading false rumours that some countries around the Korean peninsula are changing their position in favor of U.S. military presence in this part of the world.
   Rodong Sinmun today brands this as a third-rate trick to justify their sycophantic and traitorous begging for U.S. troops' permanent occupation of South Korea.
   The news analyst says:
   There is no one who will lend an ear to the false propaganda of the colonial stooges.
   The U.S. troops present in South Korea are the chief obstacle to peace in Korea and its independent and peaceful reunification.
   Far from drawing a lesson from the predecessors' sycophancy and treachery, the present South Korean regime is kowtowing to foreign forces more humiliatingly and depending on them more tenaciously.
   The chief executive of South Korea went so far as to say the U.S. troops should remain even after Korea is reunified.
   As their treacherous logic failed to work, the puppets resort to false propaganda to justify the U.S. troops' permanent occupation of South Korea.
   This reveals that they are despicable sycophants and traitors who have no sense of independence and prolong their dirty political career, serving as colonial slaves of foreign forces.
   The U.S. military presence in South Korea can by no means be justified.

articles.title: Buddhist prayer services for reunification
articles.content:
Institute on S. Korean authorities' anti-north campaign
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the National Reunification Institute issued a statement today on the continued smear campaign conducted in South Korea against the northern system.
   The campaign comes behind the facade of calls for "improvement of inter-Korean relations" and "reconciliation and cooperation."
   The spokesman said:
   Since the change of "government" in South Korea in February, the number of anti-north slanders more than trebled.
   The South Korean puppets' anti-north propaganda materials are larger than before in quantity and variety. Besides propaganda through radio and newspaper, they scatter anticommunist publications from the sky through balloons. 
   They even insert such materials into humanitarian goods sent to the north through international agencies.
   What is intolerable is that the anti-north campaign is targeted at the dignified social system of the north.
   The proportion of slanders at the social system is more than two thirds of the anti-north smear campaign. It is getting more vicious.
   The developments in South Korea show that the present regime, though calling itself "people's government," is a group of more vicious anti-communist, anti-north fanatics than the preceding regime and that their wish is not improvement of inter-Korean relations, reconciliation and cooperation but aggravation of the tensions and confrontation with the north.
   The "Agency for National Security Planning" and the "Unification Ministry" stand behind the anti-north smear campaign. It is "Minister" Kang In Dok who is notorious for anti-north slanders.
   Taking advantage of the temporary difficulties of fellow countrymen, the South Korean puppets are abusing this opportunity for their sinister political purposes.    This only goes to reveal their moral vulgarity and despicability.
   Human scum who defected to South Korea after committing crimes in the north are used in this campaign. This is a third-rate drama and a dirge of the doomed.
   The South Korean authorities must immediately stop the smear campaign against the headquarters of the Korean revolution, dissolve the anti-communist den "Agency for National Security Planning," operate on the "Unification Ministry" and dismiss Kang In Dok, who plays the role of shock brigade in anti-north confrontation, as "Unification Minister." 
   We sternly warn the South Korean authorities that without such measures there can be no genuine improvement of relations, reconciliation and cooperation between the north and south.

articles.title: Palhae relics exhibition opens
articles.content:
Buddhist prayer services for reunification
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Buddhists held prayer services for reunification at temples  across the country on July 4, the 26th anniversary of the publication of the historic  north-south joint statement.
   Rituals of praying for the reunification of the country were followed by speeches.
   The speakers urged the present South Korean rulers depending on foreign forces and opposing reunification to stop suppressing the pro-reunification forces and remove obstacles to reunification.
   The "grand festival for national reconciliation, unity and reunification" for which Koreans in the north, south and abroad will get together at Panmunjom on August 15 this year should be made to be an assembly for implementing the five-point policy of great national unity, they noted.
   The services expressed the firm will of the Buddhists in the northern half of Korea to conduct positive activities of solidarity with the counterparts in South Korea and overseas.

articles.title: Month of international solidarity with Korean people opens
articles.content:
Palhae relics exhibition opens
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- A Palhae relics exhibition opened at the Korean Central History Museum on July 4 to mark the 1,300th founding anniversary of the state of Palhae.
   On display are nearly 300 cultural relics which date bock to the period of Palhae (698-926).
   The exhibited relics include an ornamental hairpin, a jewel, a gilt bronze ring, an ink slab and other decorations, household effects,  porcelain, labor tools and weaponry.
   They also include a jar, pieces of a mirror broken and a gilt bronze ornament from tomb ruins.
   A gold earring, a helmet and other relics show succession of Palhae to Koguryo.
   Palhae was a powerful state founded by nomadic people of Koguryo on the land where Koguryo had existed. It lasted for nearly 230 years as a "powerful country" in the east.

articles.title: S. Korea censured for despicable smear campaign
articles.content:
Month of international solidarity with Korean people opens 
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- A month of international solidarity with the Korean people opened in different countries. 
   Meetings took place in Romania, Ethiopia and Mongolia from June 27 to July 1.
   It was noted at the meetings that the Korean people won a brilliant victory in the fatherland liberation war thanks to the brilliant strategy  and wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
   The U.S. military occupation of South Korea is the main obstacle to the reunification of Korea, the speakers at the meetings said. The U.S. troops should withdraw from South Korea unconditionally and immediately and the armistice agreement be replaced by a peace agreement, they urged.
   They also said that the five-point policy of great national unity advanced by  General Kim Jong Il should be implemented thoroughly.
   The meetings expressed support and solidarity for the Korean people in their struggle for socialist construction and national reunification.

articles.title: Literature scattered in S. Korea
articles.content:
S. Korea censured for despicable smear campaign
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland was interviewed by KCNA today over the South Korean puppets' Despicable smear campaign.
   The spokesman said:
   Some media of South Korea, on the order of the "government" authorities, alleged that the South Korean puppet army captured President Kim Il Sung's car on the River Chongchon during the Korean War and that the car was repaired and taken on a trial run again 48 years later.
   The barefaced lie came at a time when the June 25-July 27 month of the joint anti-U.S. struggle began and when the fourth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was drawing near. South Korean people and the progressive people across the world are speaking highly of the prestige and feats of the President, who was the first in history to defeat the U.S. imperialists, who were boasting of being the strongest in the world. The reverence of the entire nation and humankind for him is ever growing.
   The South Korean puppets' smear campaign is the most vicious and profane provocation to the north and the never-to-be-condoned crime against the nation.
   We bitterly denounce the South Korean puppets, who invented the downright lie, as a group of the most heinous separatists seeking confrontation with the north. We warn them to stop such criminal plots at once.

articles.title: U.S. shocking crimes
articles.content:
Literature scattered in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Many copies of literature, 26 cm long and 18 cm wide, in the name of the patriotic soldiers society were scattered on the ground in front of the barracks of a South Korean puppet army unit on June 18, according to radio Voice of National Salvation from Seoul.
   Written in the literature were the following letters: the way of changing the destiny of the Korean nation lies in believing in and following Kim Jong Il, the greatest man. 
   Let us bear deeper in our hearts the greatness of illustrious commander Kim Jong Il and entrust all our destiny to him. Let us pledge loyalty to him in order to become true patriotic soldiers for the nation, not  U.S. colonial mercenary soldiers.
